page.title: 05Anfield Farm, Cockermouth
page.content: Anfield Farm is the closest to the town and I went to see how much livestock was on this farm. I took the public footpath which climbs Slatefell and walked through rough pasture. Many Friesians were grazing. I climbed the lower slopes, crossed a stile into a large silage field and followed a hidden track to the sheds. As I turned the corner I was greeted by four dogs and the farmer's wife.She showed me Bess's six puppies four days old.She told me cattle rearing was the family's work and showed me the sheds where 500 spend the winter. All the family feed,milk and clean every day. There was one shed full of beautifully coloured pedigree calves. The V.I.P.is Meadowlake Butler,the Holstein Bull. Anfield cattle win Cockermouth Show Championships in most years.
